title: Dr. Daniel Chappell
text: We have been patients of Dr. Daniel Chappell since he first came to bountiful Utah many many years ago and we would never trade and go to another doctor. He will do virtual visits over the phone and we also visit him once in a while. We are 82 and 83 and we find him to be extremely knowledgeable about people of our age group yet he delivers new babies. He has an amazing knowledge with medicine and how to take care of ourselves naturally. He is very patient he listens to every question and answers our questions. And has gone out of his way to send prescriptions to nearby pharmacy after I called about a problem I had a couple of days ago. I was very touched by his intuition that I needed something from them pharmacy. You cannot go wrong visiting Dr. Daniel Chappell ofOgden clinic Farmington Utah

title: I‚Äôve Been Disappointed
text: I had high expectations of this app, seeing as it is the world‚Äôs most used digital map. I was disappointed, however. The app does not keep pace with your vehicle, the map on your route displays turns as if they are far away, and then you suddenly miss the turn. It‚Äôs like the digital depth perception is off. I made more wrong turns using this app than I have with Apple Maps, Waze, or my car‚Äôs built in navigation. I will admit that it is convenient to see the location pictures (street view and review pics) and reviews all in the same place. I also like that when other navigation programs do not have the listed address, Google Maps usually does. However, these pros were not helpful enough to outweigh the cons. It‚Äôs hard for me to believe that Google has dropped the ball so much here. I am deleting it.

title: Waze or Google Maps
text: Just like Google and Nest after Google bought Nest it is getting tough to decide which way to interact with these services. Google Maps is very robust but I prefer the way that Waze does navigation. While Google Maps benefits from the Waze data it does not seem that the reverse can be said about Waze. Yet Waze still seems to do navigation better. Google needs to get on with merging Google Maps and Waze into one product and give us the best of both. They‚Äôre both 5 star apps but when it comes to navigation Waze is just 0.001 stars better. Google Maps is so much more than navigation which is why I have both downloaded on my phone but Google Maps would be the ultimate maps app if they just merged Waze into it.

title: Not letting me label
text:
I use google maps a lot, anywhere new I go I pull it up. I can‚Äôt say there aren‚Äôt glitches sometimes but I have not came across anything huge. However, I‚Äôm upset about the ability for me to label places such as ‚Äúhome‚Äù and ‚Äúwork‚Äù. My last iPhone had these labeled just fine, therefore if I was driving I could just type in ‚Äúhome‚Äù rather than my entire address which is much more time with my eyes on the phone. But as soon as I upgraded my IPhone, the labels were no longer there and the button doesn‚Äôt seem to do anything when I click it. And there isn‚Äôt even one now for my place of work. With me just changing iPhones I didn‚Äôt think it would be that big of a deal but it really takes a lot of time off the road to type in my entire address and that‚Äôs dangerous. 
But I do enjoy using the app when needed and it gets me from point A to point B

title: Latest update removed traffic on by default
text:
If you use this app for traffic DO NOT UPDATE.  Traffic previously was on by default, that is no longer the case, and there is no way to change it.  Every time you want to check the traffic, you have to go into the layers and now turn traffic back on.  Close the app, and then come back in, guess what, traffic is gone again!  After about the 3rd time of, "why is there traffic, my app said there was no traffic?!"  Oh... pos turned turned traffic off with the update.  Rip.  App is usually 5 stars.  Latest update made it infuriating.  Fix traffic on by default, or let us manually turn traffic on and leave it on, and you'll go back to 5 stars.

Thanks for the reply.  Back to 5 stars.

title: Uses too much data
text: I‚Äôm a big of the Google maps app. I‚Äôve used it for years on the iPhone 6s Plus. Unfortunately for the last year or so. Google maps has been using an astonishing amount of data. 3-4 megabytes per minute. I‚Äôve downloaded all the local maps via WiFi but still the app eats data. Most of the time I go to Settings/cellular and turn off cellular data for Google maps. It still works with gps but that leaves me without traffic updates and the maps are blurry. I just upgraded to an iPhone 11 and put in a new Verizon sim card but the high data use remains unchanged. I can easily see the data use by resetting data statistics and turning on and off cell data for the app. I can‚Äôt find anyone with a similar problem online and the Verizon guy hadn‚Äôt heard of this issue before. Any help out there?

title: Google is my go to map but.......
text: I have always used google map as my main navigation system. I love the satellite view which helps looking for places and navigating to places super easy. The simplicity of the design and overall app is just what I need. However, apps like Waze, (which I think is operated by Google. Idk) is adding updates and changing how we should use a map. You can add all types of indicators such as traffic, or accidents and even where Police officers are. It‚Äôs very user friendly and community friendly. It‚Äôs all about helping each other around you get places faster and safer. I feel like if Google Maps can implement where we can tag police officers locations or just so we can tag and indicate anything on the map, it would be the perfect map. But overall it‚Äôs still my go to navigation app. üëåüèº

title: Love it‚Äî these are just potential enhancement mentions.
text:
I use this app every day for basically everything due to time management.

I think the ‚Äúleave on time‚Äù feature can use a little bit of an adjustment. Lately, I‚Äôve been leaving 20 minutes SOONER than mentioned and still arriving 40 minutes late due to unexpected rush-hours. 

***One other feature that would SUPER FREAKING FANTASTIC would be the ability to take the scenic route somewhere. I road-trip a lot and sometimes I‚Äôd rather just be able to go check out a byway along the route that‚Äôs scenic than be forced to stay on the highway for the ‚Äúfastest route‚Äù. ***

Something else that could be a potential feature would be to avoid high-crime areas. One route the app typically wants to take me down has a strong history for being not the greatest neighborhood (think Amanda Berry release story potential). Fair warning would be super helpful in these parts of town (potentially with a feature to turn it off if someone is okay with it)?

Regardless, like I said, I borderline abuse this app. I‚Äôve been using it almost to the annoyance of my boyfriend because I keep finding new places to go with him. Will always keep using as opposed to the built in feature in the phone itself for ios.

title: Getting worse and worse
text: Have been using Google maps as my most trusted navigation for many years. As a person that drives a lot because of work (more than 30,000 miles / per year) I needed an app that would show me the most efficient way to get to my appointments while having the most accurate ETAs possible. And, indeed Google Maps used to be exactly this. But, over the past 2 years, I have consistently been let down and it seems to be getting worse and worse. It started by being constantly off (by 10 - 20 min) on the ETAs and now it even suggests routs that are longer, more time consuming and overall way less convenient and efficient for no reason at all. I ve been comparing it to other apps (such as Waze) and every other app seems to be navigating me way more proficiently. I am so sorry but it seems that Google has pulled the financial plug away from Maps having completely abandoned it. RIP Google Maps

title: San Jose in Bolivia? Yeah, right‚Ä¶
text:
So the girl I like lives in San Jose, and we‚Äôre making plans to see each other. Just normal two people in love kinda thing. I asked her for her address to start organizing my trip to see her, so she sends me her address which is in San Jose. She didn‚Äôt actually send the address, she sent me the coordinates because she was trying to be as accurate as possible. So I copy the coordinates, enter in google maps and where does it send me? To freaking Venezuela, that‚Äôs a whole different country, okay, Google maps? You should google that‚Ä¶

Anyway, I just think it‚Äôs unbelievable that I‚Äôve been using this thing for years. Can you imagine how many times it probably sent me to the wrong restaurant and I didn‚Äôt even notice? Or to a friends house? And then I just accidentally hung out with weirdos without even realizing those people were not my real friends?

I‚Äôll tell you more, this is probably why that one time I went on this date and my date never showed up. Google maps definitely took me to the wrong 7-eleven! That‚Äôs why she blocked me on everything too, probably because she was mad at me for never showing up to our date.

What‚Äôs next? One day it will decide that I don‚Äôt work in Portland anymore and it will just send me to El Salvador instead? Do you get what I mean??? I can‚Äôt trust this app anymore. 

Stay away from this app people‚Ä¶. Just stay away.

title: I wish G maps would not change their algorithms
text:
Ive been loyally using Google maps for decades. I use it to find restaurants, stores, discover random places, use it as my guide to my surroundings, whether walking or drive occasionally. In the past few years they changed driving routes that dont make sense. Im aware of my route enough that maps doesnt make sense to go through certain streets. It seems like the app reverts to a time where it wasnt smart enough to know better. 
Although its a frustrating thing, I still use Gmaps to drive from a to b, find places and discover new things. At this point, Im a bit weary of what Google is doing- perhaps planning on making us pay for their dependable services in the future? All at the same time Im giving them my location.

title: New update.
text: The new update with the dark mode is excellent. Saves my eyes. But the new layout and separate tabs for exploring or directions is not it. It Used to be very easy, if you were lost while driving, to type an address and get the gps going. Now you have to do a bunch of extra unnecessary steps to get the GPS. No need to separate directions and ‚Äúexplore‚Äù into different tabs. to when you could explore places just fine. I don‚Äôt need a tab with a bunch of posts of things around me. I‚Äôll go to Facebook for that. Or Instagram. If I want to see pictures I‚Äôll click on the establishment I want to see pictures of. The pop up menu at the bottom of my screen is intrusive. When I‚Äôm in the unnecessary ‚Äúgo‚Äù tab and search it only gives an option for directions. I DONT WANT DIRECTIONS I WANT THE GPS!!!!!!!!!!!! Horrible execution in app design/ functionality. Probably going back to Apple Maps and deleting this trash. ‚ÄúExplore tab is useless clutter.

title: What happened with the update???
text: It used to be great but now they have changed it into something that‚Äôs so hard to use, all the transportation modes are cramped together in one page, and automatically ranked in the order of drive-walk-public transport, you can‚Äôt choose to show or hide a transportation mode, you can‚Äôt even move your preferred mode to the top, so if you are someone who take public transportation a lot, every time you open the app you‚Äôll have to scroll down to see what‚Äôs up. And it will only show 1 or 2 route for each modes, there used to be 3 or 4 routes when you choose the public transportation mode. Lastly, there used to be options that you can choose the routes with least walking time or least transfers for public transportations but now those options are all gone. Now this app is completely unusable, can‚Äôt even compare to the apple map. Who even came up with these stupid ideas??? Please change it back!!!!!

title: Great For Directions, Not For Public Transit
text: I‚Äôve fell in love with Google Maps ever since switching from Apple Maps. The integration and User Interface is just fantastic. I use basically all the features. Unfortunately, the feature for public transit is lacking. I usually take the CTA bus and the arrival times isn‚Äôt always accurate. One time I arrived a minute early, and after several minutes of waiting, it shows that the bus departed 3 minutes earlier than scheduled. I thought maybe it was a one time thing. Days later, same thing happens except this time it states that it departed 10 minutes earlier than scheduled! I even took a screenshot because I simply couldn‚Äôt believe it. How could it be that off? Highly recommend only trusting the arrival times on the CTA website.

title: Removed option to select optional routes or edit route
text:
Previously there would be multiple routes suggested and I could tap on one of the gray  ones to select it (it would turn blue) or I could press and hold on the blue route, a blue dot would appear and I could drag it onto another road to redraw the best route that goes past that point. It‚Äôs been like this for a decade or more, until you removed it. 

I tried forcing it to go on a freeway by entering its name and city. Example: highway 17 Campbell CA. It now insists that I must exit the freeway, go back an exit, then get off and back on again going my original way. It does this no matter what freeway, city, or direction I‚Äôm going, it insists I have to travel between 2 exits 3 times (eg north, then south, then north again).  What idiot thought this was the least bit useful?

This makes it 100% useless for determining how much longer it might take if I want to drive a different route from the single route it suggests. I have good reasons for wanting to take a different route (such as much safer freeway merges with longer merging lanes and better visibility) and I *believe* it will only add 2-3 minutes (on a 1 hour 40 minute trip) to the trip but because you have broken what once worked beautifully, I can no longer get the answer with this app. 

Why do you guys keep breaking what works? Why do you stupidly think you know better than all your users what features we need?

title: You ruined the app
text: It used to be very simple to use.  You click on the directions button and it would automatically take me to the app and pull up the direction options, all with one tap.  Now, ever since two updates ago it takes many more steps.  I tap directions and it takes me to directions on the website, that‚Äôs if it loads which it doesn‚Äôt always, then it asks if I would rather use the app, click yes and it says it will save the address for me.  However for unknown reasons it doesn‚Äôt go right to the app I have installed, it has to go through the App Store.  Then I have to click on open in the App Store.  Finally I‚Äôm in the app, but I still need to tap destination and hope the address is saved, isn‚Äôt always, and ‚Äúadd‚Äù the address for my destination.  You made something that was very easy to use into something that now takes multiple steps where things can go wrong.  Go back to the way it used to be.

title: Great app, but needs improvement after updates
text:
I had originally given this a 5-star review, but the app appears to still have way too many glitches that it‚Äôs been a frustrating experience trying to use it for directions. 

I originally really enjoyed this app, so much so that I deleted the default apple maps app, but I have now deleted google maps, as there appears to be a lot of bugs since the last update. The app constantly thinks I‚Äôm on the street when I‚Äôm on the freeway which throws my directions all off. Additionally, the app appears to freeze in one location pretty regularly, and I have to close the app and restart it to get it to track my location accurately again, as it freezes with the last directions showing, and I‚Äôm literally driving blind at that point till I notice that it has frozen again.

I was a big fan of the app before, but it‚Äôs a little too frustrating for me to use at this point. as it does not appear to be as reliable as it was before.

title: Needs work
text: It‚Äôs a good app but has several bugs that make it really frustrating at times. As mentioned previously, the app freezes sometimes. Other times, the voice navigation stops completely and you have to look at the app to see where you have to go which can be dangerous while driving. Sometimes the displayed map gets completely flipped and there‚Äôs no way to align it with the way you‚Äôre actually driving without taking the map ‚Äúoff center‚Äù. My final issue which is the MOST FRUSTRATING is that the app continuously makes mistakes in location in regards to whether you‚Äôre on a highway or not. It constantly thinks I‚Äôm a street over and missed the entrance, which leads it to make several contradictory, confusing statements in a short span of time. This alone has caused me problems so many times since I‚Äôve moved to a new city that I‚Äôm giving up using the app.

title: Too many unwanted route changes
text: When given route options, I chose my preferred route. Somewhere along the way, a question about changing the route came up on my screen. Because I was driving, I didn‚Äôt see it in time to touch ‚ÄúNo Thanks‚Äù. My route was then changed and I was 35 minutes out of the way before I realized it. I had to drop a pin at a business on my preferred route and make that a stop so that Google maps would navigate me on the route I chose to begin with. This happened on the return trip as well. I used to love Google Maps. Now, it takes the fun out of traveling for me. I‚Äôm writing this review because this experience has repeated itself too many times over the last couple of years and I‚Äôm extremely unhappy with these changes. If I choose a route, it should keep me on that route unless I choose otherwise! PERIOD! I‚Äôll be ordering a new road atlas and going old school after this last trip. DONE WITH GOOGLE MAPS!

title: Pls stop the "Latest in the area" üò°
text:
Every new option or feature that you add to an app should be OPTIONAL, not forced on me by your development team. Maybe I'm a strange bird, but I use Maps to navigate from point A to B. That's the mission of a navigation app - TO NAVIGATE. This isn't a news app, I don't need to know the "latest in the area". If I wanted that, I'd fire up Twitter. 

If your user base wants this feature then great for them; pls just let me check a box that says something like "never show me the latest in the area". All this window/overlay does is get my in way and annoy me - it doesn't add value to my experience, it takes away value. 

Post Script: I live in the middle of nowhere farmland, so the latest in the area for me is a cow taking a giant dump, or a tractor plowing a field. If your developers ever left the comfort of their mom's basement they might realize how useless the features are that they're building. Cut the crap and focus on the purpose of this app! (Hey, that rhymed!)

title: Recently gotten BAD
text: I‚Äôve used Google maps for years and used to be pretty good. Over the last month it‚Äôs told me to turn the wrong way down 1 way streets, brought me to construction instead of routing me away from construction and said I‚Äôd arrived at my destination when I was 30 miles away to a random parking lot it led me to. The end of 2019 I used the walking directions in San Diego and it seemed to not have a clue where I was or where I was going. Yesterday I again gave the walking directions a change in Boston and the same thing, it gave me directions to walk THROUGH buildings, had me cross bridges just to cross the same body of water, lead me in circles and overall just not got me to any of my destinations. Then when we went to leave it couldn‚Äôt handle the layered streets. Meanwhile Apple Maps that has 1/10th of the development costs invested worked flawlessly in every one of these locations. Unless you are ONLY on the highway find another app.

title: I never write reviews
text: I never write reviews but in this case I had to. I use to always use the Maps app until recently I‚Äôve noticed that certain places will not open up in the Maps app and they prompt you to download the Google Maps so I did. At first it was great. Worked just like the regular maps I had on my phone already, but now for the past several weeks whenever I Google a location that I want to go to and I tap on the address to be navigated there it opens up the map and I choose use current location as my starting point. it will then open the map and have me sitting there in the middle of nowhere with the little blue radius just sitting there pulsating and it will not direct me turn right turn left go to this street go to that street it does not give any directions now what so ever on where to go. it will always show me how to get there on the overview and how long it will take me to get there but that‚Äôs it it won‚Äôt give me any directions so it‚Äôs worth less now.

title: Stop advertising during the trip
text:
I‚Äôve never written a review for an app before, yet here I am sitting in the parking lot of my destination because it‚Äôs so annoying that google maps keeps telling me to ‚Äúturn left after McDonalds‚Äù or ‚Äúcontinue straight past Chase Bank.‚Äù I can‚Äôt stand it. I hate being verbally advertised to while I‚Äôm driving ‚Äî it‚Äôs distracting and ineffective and it also makes navigating more difficult. It also makes the instructions take 3 times as long to be communicated to you. I literally hate the interface and functionality and all the dumb icons and stickers of waze, but I guess that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm using now.

Oh and, it‚Äôs really annoying when it tells you to turn left without a signal onto a 6 lane street at rush hour when you could have just stayed on the big street you were already on and gotten through fine. And it can never figure out what direction I‚Äôm facing anymore so it‚Äôs always confused about what to tell me to do, making it pretty useless anyway.

title: Great app
text: I normally don‚Äôt post reviews, and I‚Äôm not really breaking from that now. Lol, I do use google maps when my 7 inch gps can‚Äôt locate something, google maps has NEVER failed to locate it. I write this review to ask, ‚Äú you people writing reviews cry much?‚Äù I mean ,for real ,someone wrote that the app was steering him into police traps, really? I mean really? Police traps!! What exactly is a police trap anyways? Stop doing stuff the cops don‚Äôt like and there will be no traps that can catch you. LOL, As for the rest I would just say, if your too cheap to buy a gps and you still need a way to navigate you really can‚Äôt go wrong with google maps. I‚Äôm a truck driver and I search for a lot of addresses. I‚Äôve decided if google maps can‚Äôt find it , then it simply doesn‚Äôt exist!

title: Several changes‚Ä¶
text: Are usually love Google maps but lately it seems like it‚Äôs not working quite properly. What I have noticed is when I am riding on the highway and it‚Äôs giving me a notification that I need to exit to my destinations and it gives me a number example 826 E. but the name is up on the green. The sign says the Palmetto Expressway. It was last minute decision as to whether you get off the highway or not are critical and Google maps has not been helping lately. I also do not like when Google maps says ‚Äúturn here‚Äù. Turn here, is not so bad if you knew the name of the street that you‚Äôre turning on I‚Äôm not getting that information. I deleted the app and re-downloaded it. I was hoping this would update and correct the problem but it did not.

title: FRUSTRATING- DELETING THE APP!!!
text:
Over the last few months Google Maps has been routing me through private driveways, narrow residential streets with kids running across, or streets with a million stop signs and traffic lights, all the while between the same start and end destinations, even if The most straightforward route has no traffic at all. I‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôm either going to get in an accident or run over some kid on a residential street. 

Yesterday I was driving to a store which was 3 miles away, it made me get on the highway, drive 5 miles in the opposite direction to the next exit, turn around and get back on the highway in the other direction for 7 miles. The store was a straight shot from where I started and I didn‚Äôt even need to get on the highway. They‚Äôre doing some kind of weird traffic balancing behind the scenes and sending people on different routes. Seems illegal!!!! Google needs to get it‚Äôs act together!!! I‚Äôm deleting the app for now.

title: Dangerous rerouting during navigation
text: I cannot stress enough how dangerous this is. I had selected a major highway route over a faster county road route for night driving because there wouldn‚Äôt be any animals on the major highway (foreshadowing). I had specifically selected the highway route of the possible routes presented to me. I started driving towards my intended route and the app asked me if I‚Äôd like to change the route to the faster county roads. I already selected the route I wanted so I pressed ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt change route‚Äù on my phone while I was driving and I had to make sure I‚Äôm still going the way I wanted. Then a while later the app reroutes me anyways without sufficiently telling me. I think I missed my exit and turn around the way I came, not knowing the app is now taking me on the county road route I did not want. Of course the foreshadowing can tell you how that went. I hit a bowling ball of a hog with my brothers Beamer and now I gotta tell him why.

title: Reference to their comment
text: I have contacted them several times and they refuse to correct their mistakes. They installed the wrong skylight for the pitch of roof and installed improperly. I have had a couple of roofing co take a look and was informed that there are soft spots on the roof which would indicate that under shingles that the wood should have been replaced at the time they replaced the roof. Many people may say their work is good because they really didn‚Äôt check the roof or had different ones do their work .The roof should not have passed inspection because at the time they did not step foot on the roof. When I went to paint the overhang I found rotted wood showed it to them and they still refused to replace it. They say they give you a 4 year warrantee but yet they don‚Äôt take care of the problems. If you want a roof that may have rotted wood put wrong skylight up and don‚Äôt stand behind their work , go ahead and call southern pro restoration, because they are forcing me to take them to court for them to do anything.

title: Freezes and crashes with new iOS update
text:
I am a software developer and feel I have gone through the typical debugging steps but the issues still persists. 

After updating to iOS 13.6 my google maps is constantly freezing. I use it multiple times a day and have for the past 5+ years. This has never happened before and is a direct correlation with the new iOS update. Is Apple sabotaging google maps to force users to use Apple Maps? I think it‚Äôs a possibility. I‚Äôve restarted my phone, uninstalled the app and re installed. But the issue continues every time I use it. It‚Äôs going on about 10 days of consistent freezing. 

I will start a route and after a few minutes it will just freeze, not updating the time left, or position on the map. When I click on anything on the screen the app is not responsive. After 30 sec or so the app will either crash a s close, or respond to what I clicked on previously. No other apps are doing this. I have an iPhone X.

title: I‚Äôm a very big Google fan but I'm disappointed with Google maps lately
text: Let me start by saying I'm a Google fan. I always been using Google maps and it was always working great. It used to announce the turns multiple times like in 2 miles, 0.5 miles take exit X and so on. But now since past one month it stopped announcing intermittently and also the banner on the top which shows directions is also not getting updated to the correct turns. I have no problem with any other apps with either internet or even my phone. I got iPhone 11 pro. And the internet is also on 4G LTE. My app is upto date. I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but looking at the app I love being buggy is making me feel bad. I can share any logs or information that would help you guys figure out what‚Äôs wrong. Please don‚Äôt respond generic saying update app or check any settings. It‚Äôs clearly the app.

title: Hope you enjoy the review
text: I personally think That Google maps perform so much better compared to iOS maps. Yesterday me & my boyfriend we‚Äôre driving to the airport & we were just on a main Road that had a simple Right turn. The iOS told us to take a Left & there was not left turn because if we did we would‚Äôve went head on towards traffic. Not safe for The IOS default maps. This is the reason why I went with good maps because I know google Maps is very Safe & it‚Äôs very organized & they actually give you the Correct Directions. Anyways my point is to Stay with Google maps especially if you currently use IOS maps. Google maps is Honestly better.

title: My ‚ÄúGo To‚Äù App for more than Navi
text: I use this app daily. I use it to quickly find info on businesses or restaurants in my area as well as other areas. From there I can see the phone #, hours of operation, pics, reviews, busy times or not...in real time! Many other functions I can‚Äôt recall off the top of my head. But...I usually go to Waze for my drive. I don‚Äôt know why, I just like it better with real-time traffic and accidents, also police and red light camera warnings. I do sometimes use this app for my drive if I feel Waze isn‚Äôt taking me the right way but honestly I have more errors of destination with Google. Perhaps it‚Äôs because on Waze you can contribute to the routs and shortcuts. They seem to study the routes one takes and I believe their updates are done quickly. But I still love this app for info.

title: One Ways
text:
I've been a long term user with Google Maps and it's always incredibly accurate with traffic conditions and travel times. It is excellent in providing lane information and getting you efficiently from point A to point B.

I do have one issue that is rather significant enough to lower my review from a perfect 5 stars to a 4 star rating. The app will try and direct you in the wrong direction down one way streets. Be very cautious when you are making turns that the direction the app is directing you in is a valid and legal turn.

In conclusion, this is not a completely major issue so long you follow the rules of the road in addition to the app's instruction. This app is a fantastic app at getting you where you need to be. By far, I would recommend this app well beyond the other navigational apps out there.

title: Updates aren‚Äôt always better
text:
Today, 5/9/23, I‚Äôm using google map. Since the last update I‚Äôm having problems.  I enter my route, it gives me options, I choose the shortest  time wise. The app keeps highlighting the longer route for some reason.  My chosen route has a minor detour involved but is still fastest.  I begin driving.  In the middle of my route she starts telling me to take the next exit which is 300 miles too soon! She‚Äôs still trying to get me off my chosen route! Irritating.  

The other issue is when I look up a route it allows me to choose ‚Äúfrom where‚Äù, location, a named place, or choose on map.  I WANT IT TO AUTOMATICALLY DEFAULT TO MY CURRENT LOCATION unless I direct differently.  There is no way to do that.  My settings are set to access my location when I use the app or widget.  

Not happy since last update.

title: Unsafe. Tried to do too much.
text:
I miss a simpler experience maybe, but Maps has become bloated and unsafe. 
My biggest gripe is that it forces you to interact with the screen WHILE DRIVING. I always pick a route and start navigation before driving. Often I pick a route that is literally 2 minutes slower than the fastest route. So what happens?
15 minutes into the trip it pops up that a faster route is available. Not due to traffic or changing conditions, just that original TWO MINUTES I specifically did not select. If I don‚Äôt dismiss it the app automatically switches my route! Hello google, it‚Äôs illegal to mess with your phone while driving! 
Didn‚Äôt notice the pop-up? Now you have to manually reroute on the map, again this is illegal. And what happens the moment you do? That‚Äôs right, Google AGAIN gives the pop up advising that I can save TWO MINUTES, so again I have to dismiss it.

title: Not good as it used to be
text:
I used to be an avid google maps user. This app used to come up with ingenious routes to avoid traffic. However, over the course of past year its quality deteriorated quite substantially.

First off, I got lost using google maps in Turkey. The app took me to literally nowhere. I mean the paved road ended and I continued on dirt road. Even that road ended and at that point I decided to switch to Yandex Maps which is superior in that region.

I still continued it in the US. However, in this past trip, I noticed that the app only suggested BP or little known petrol stations on my trip. The best result was suggesting me to add 15 mins to my trip. At the same time, I was passing an exit sign showing me a Shell station a mile away.

The last incident occurred during my trip from NYC to Raleigh. It took me through a stand still traffic of +35 mins. At that point, I was do bored that I downloaded Waze to see if there are alternative routes. As a matter of fact, there was! Waze came up with a 10 min improvement which was quite substantial for my trip. Hence, I am switching to Waze at this point. I hope they‚Äôll fix the app soon.

I am giving 3 starts for the average of my past five star experiences and my current one star experience.

title: Trash street view and chooses longer routes automatically
text: Pretty good app most of the time, but a few items irk me enough to write a review and drop two stars. The street view is horrendous. Can‚Äôt view anything without accidentally touching the blue line and throwing myself down the block and losing my orientation. With the navigation, previously I noticed that google would tell me to take a longer route with more traffic but display it as the shortest route with an inaccurate ETA... like they were trying to spread/control the traffic intentionally. However with the latest update, I‚Äôve noticed that it would tell me an accurate time, but still choose the longer route. I would have to manually click the shorter route before starting directions. You would think there is no good, logical reason for this.

title: Make google maps great again
text:
In past revisions, google maps navigation was one step ahead of me. It was wonderful knowing what step comes next after my turn. This is especially important in situations where a turn occurs right after a turn. Sadly, safety is stupid, so google removed this feature, making their maps app two steps behind reality.  Or maybe im stupid and dont know how to turn that feature on, who knows. 

Furthermore, the ‚Äúzoom to my current location‚Äù button has been relocated to a horrible location. This location is approximately directly underneath the thumb  of a right handed human who is using a touch telephone in the portrait orientation. While zooming and scrolling through a map, a lazy person can easily accidentally fat thumb this button, making the desired viewing area disappear. So frustrating. 

One start because google maps has offline maps, and because zero star rating are banned :(

title: Hasn‚Äôt worked fully for past few months
text: I‚Äôve always used Google Maps over Apple Maps but I‚Äôve had several ongoing issues for the past few months. The sound has stopped working properly and I don‚Äôt think the app is announcing all the directions it should be even though I have to set to announce all directions. The app frequently thinks I‚Äôm in a different street or facing in the opposite direction or doesn‚Äôt follow along when I turn. Just two days ago I ran into a road block due to a parade and had to turn off my route but the app never recalculated directions. After 5 minutes of driving I ended up having to close the app and restart it, which isn‚Äôt exactly the safest when driving in busy city traffic. I have kept up with all app and phone updates and have a very reliable phone carrier so I don‚Äôt think this should be happening.

title: Features for the massive amount of gig workers
text: The massive amount of gig worker that use google maps we would like features like easy ability to add multiple stop routes for delivery ability to tell you a road is completely shut down and unable to travel that way due to whatever then maps truely reroutes, a feature that tells us how many times we have been to an address or if it‚Äôs the first time with the ability to see quick notes, also the detailed driving is too much especially if we like to listen to music or podcasts, we need just the very minimal basics like exactly when to turn and exit the 50 million instructions on to keep going. Straight makes us want to throw our phones please consider the millions of gig workers that relying on your app for features and updates

title: DYSA Healthcare Ultrasounds Service
text:
Title: Exceptional Ultrasound Services!

I recently had the pleasure of utilizing the services of DYSA Healthcare Ultrasounds Services and I cannot praise them enough. From start to finish, my experience with this ultrasound company service was outstanding.

First and foremost, their team of professionals is top-notch, special thanks to Ever Salazar the lead technology specialist The team was not only highly skilled and knowledgeable but also incredibly attentive an professional, I‚Äôm running two OBGYN clinics when there is an technical Ultrasound Machine issue you need a solution on the spot.

Calling Ever at 8 am and having the whole team fixing the Ultrasound equipment in 30 minutes is priceless.

Their promptness in providing results was also impressive, alleviating any unnecessary anxiety.

In conclusion, I highly recommend DYSA Healthcare Ultrasound Services to anyone in need of ultrasound services. Their exceptional team, state-of-the-art technology, and commitment to clients care make them a top choice in the field. My experience was nothing short of outstanding, and I am grateful to have found such a reliable and trustworthy technical ultrasound company.

title: Strange little app
text:
If I'm searching for a well known place (ie Taco Bell) and select "all locations" from the available menu, it says no results returned; search Google instead? But if I watch a specific store at a specific location (Taco Bell @ 123 East Main Street) I get a result. Usually what I'm looking for is a broadcast range of locations to choose from and it has lost that functionality.
Plus it often takes me the loooooooooooong way around to whatever location I'm going to such as Home Depot just today. I had a straight shot on the map that I could see that your algorithm was completely blind to. Some say it's a snafu, but I'm going to ask how much in kickbacks are you getting from the gasoline companies? üò† There's been yeeeeears to work that out but it's still in there.

title: Hello devs, please read
text:
Hello Devs, I love your app and use it all the time. However, a couple years ago, you changed the voice mute button to include some alerts option.  I‚Äôve never used this option.  I driver 30,000 miles a year and I‚Äôm constantly toggling between mute voice and not mute.  However, instead of just being able to tap on the screen once, like it used to be, now I need to tap on the screen and take my eyes off the road to then select the option to mute it.  Can you change it back so the mute voice button is very easy and effortless to access?

Also, another big problem.  This started around September or October 2019.  Right when I upgraded to an iPhone 11 Pro.  Not sure if that‚Äôs a coincidence or not.  But the problem is that the app is sometimes sluggish to route me or change routes.  It used to be almost flawless before this.  And not it happens sometimes that the map just spins looking for the route.  Or if I decide to take a different street, it is slow to calculate my new route (by slow I mean like some seconds, but enough time to possibly miss the next turn or exit.  This used to not be a problem until recently.  Somehow it is slower now!)

Anyways, keep up the good work guys!  I hope this review gets to you :)
Thank you!!

title: Great app, room for improvement
text: This app is great overall.   I love how it redirects me if there is traffic or an accident.   The one issue I have is as follows.  There is one road I travel, and it tells me to go 3 miles and then make a left.  Technically, the road dead ends in 1.2 miles and then you can only make a right turn onto a different road. After traveling 1.8 miles, I indeed do turn left onto the road I was told to turn on.  But because it doesn‚Äôt tell me to turn right, is this other roads that I will not be able to navigate correctly?  It seems like I am nitpicking, but if I use Waze, it tells me to travel 1.2 miles and turn right.  While we are on the subject of Waze, why can‚Äôt Google add the feature from Waze that lets me specify a number of mph above the limit before it sounds an alarm.

title: Service department
text:
I‚Äôve loved getting my cars from Hubert Vester Toyoto for several years and I only deal with one salesperson.
I‚Äôve always had good service in the past from the service technicians too. However, my last three visits have turned me off! The staff was rude and judgmental. Today I went for a free oil change on my brand new Camry. 
I simply asked were they very busy and approximately how long it would take. I had worked that night and was willing to wait but not if it was very long. Miss smarty pants asked (and not very nicely) ‚ÄúDid you make an appointment?‚Äù Duh, if I had any appointment I would have said so. 
She said it would be about an hour and a half. So I said I would wait. 
I wait, and waited and waited some more. People came after me and left (no they all didn‚Äôt have appointment; how do I know? Cause they talk loud enough that everyone can heard..smh).
Anyway, I‚Äôm aware that you take a chance when you just ‚Äúshow up‚Äù for service but that‚Äôs no excuse to display poor customer service. If she had said it was gonna be a very long time I would have come back or make an appointment for another day. 
I‚Äôve taken my cars to Toyoto in Wilson so many times and spend so much money when I could have went somewhere else.
New customer service staff... new attitudes. Well, no thank!

title: Alta Builders Rocks
text:
We recently had our roof shingles replaced by Alta Builders. I couldn‚Äôt be more happy with the quality of work that was completed. They were timely, professional and the person over our job named Mark Fullmer was an absolute stud.
From day one Mark took ownership of our job and he took control working with our insurance company to cover the majority of the costs because of wind and storm damage. After the insurance company came and assessed the work they estimates just over $17,000 to complete the work. Because of Mark‚Äôs help we ended up paying only $2,500 out of pocket. I give Alta Builders 5 Stars and would recommend them to anyone! Thanks for your great and complete work Alta Builders! Mark Fullmer deserves a nice raise!!!!

title: I don't know why they broke the iPhone version
text:
13,July 2022 I decided to check to see if its fixed. Hahah ITS ACTUALLY WORSE Hahah this couldn't Plot the correct route 4mins, down the Road, Haha Yes Seriously. Deleted it went with WAZE. 

Google is Officially done, on Apple Devices. 

About a year later, the bugs and glitches; what Google calls features, are fixed, I still don't use the bugs and glitches. I only need a map app that works. This one doesn't. Not anymore. Goggle maps is now worse than Apple maps. I never thought that possible, until today, when Google maps, tried send me through Boston to get to Shirley from Milford. Kept directing me further and further from where I wanted to go. I pulled over downloaded Apple Maps and my trip time dropped from well over and Hour to 26 mins. Never thought I'd see the day Apple maps Destroyed Google Maps. Never thought Apple could be that good and Google that bad, at the same time.

title: Great Legal Representation.
text:

Again, allow me to reiterate and aver that I

would, not only meet, but exceed your

title: Decent Navigation
text:
I don‚Äòt typically write reviews. Especially not for a monopoly corporation such as Google. However, I was genuinely impressed with this app.
9/10 it always points me in the right direction and is the only application I know of that allows you to navigate your way through military bases, which was very helpful when I first arrived at Fort Riley.
It does have occasional hiccups. Sometimes it would direct me to an old or disused road instead of a main route. While I understand the initial reasoning is for shorter travel time, this can be very disorienting - especially with someone that may already have anxiety behind the wheel.
Overall I would recommend this app to anyone that needs swift and accurate navigational assistance. It is definitely worth having it.

title: Arrogant. Ignores the little guy.
text:
Google maps has achieved great levels of acceptance and success and they are letting it go to their head. Here is my problem with the Google maps app and why I have given it a 1 star.  I have submitted 5-6 times over the course of several months through the app for a correction of our street name. The issue is the Google maps voice on the app saying the last part of the street name ONLY.

Due to this issue, delivery drivers and visitors have gotten lost and driven on to the other side of town, wasting gas and minutes (up to an hour at times) on the road due to this mishandling. 

I am sure I am not the only one who has submitted this error but still Google maps continues to ignore / dismiss the request possibly deeming it unimportant or irrelevant since no one famous or high profile lives here.  There are decent respectable people who live here and this is not an issue about being nit-picky but about being treated correctly.

I leave reviews and am a ‚Äúlocal scout‚Äù or whatever  and still use the app due to the fact that Google maps does a few things better than other map apps I have used but I am starting to think about shutting down my Google reviews profile and email account and getting into another emailing, ID, maps system since I and my street name are deemed irrelevant by Google maps.
